ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They say, The All-Merciful has a son.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They say: "God has begotten a son."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They claim: "The Most Compassionate Lord has taken a son to Himself."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They have said that the Beneficent God has given birth to a son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And the disbelievers said, “The Most Gracious has chosen an offspring.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And they say: "The Most Gracious (Allah) has begotten a son."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And they say: The Beneficent Allah has taken (to Himself) a son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And they say, 'The All-merciful has taken unto Himself a son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And they say: The Beneficent hath taken unto Himself a son.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: They say, "The Gracious One has begotten a son."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And they say: the Compassionate hath taken a son. *Chapter: 19
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They say, ‘The All-beneficent has taken a son!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: They say: "(Allah) Most Gracious has begotten a son!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And they say: "The Most Beneficent (Allah) has begotten a son (or offspring or children) [as the Jews say: 'Uzair (Ezra) is the son of Allah, and the Christians say that He has begotten a son ['Iesa (Christ)], and the pagan Arabs say that He has begotten daughters (angels, etc.)]."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And they say: 'The Merciful has taken a son'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And they say, “The Most Merciful has begotten a son.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken [for Himself] a son."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [19:88] And they say, that is, the Jews and the Christians and those who claim that the angels are God’s daughters, ‘The Compassionate One has taken a son’. [But] God, exalted be He, says to them:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And they say) i.e. the Jews: (The Beneficent hath taken unto Himself a son) He has taken Ezra ('Uzayr) as his son.
